title: Give LeBlanc a mana cost for going back to her W / R.
body:
It's honestly retarded that Veigar can't have a stun, Kassadin can't have mobility, and Ryze can't have targeted skills, but this champion can have a gapcloser that leaps from Earth to Mars with an _UNDO BUTTON_.

Can you at least give her W a mana cost for jumping back to her W platform? She really needs a significant punishment if she fucks up like almost every other champion.

Zed's energy refund mechanic relies on either standing in the middle of a minion wave or hitting multiple skillshots from different angles simultaneously.  When played properly Akali has almost zero energy costs other than Twilight Shroud, and by design that ability gives her some breathing time.

Zed can restore a maximum of 80 energy, provided he lands every single mimicked ability.  It costs him anywhere between 120-165 energy to do so, meaning his energy return mechanic costs him a total of 40-65 energy assuming his enemy can't dodge skillshots.

Akali, on the other hand, refunds 40 energy for each 60 energy Q cast if she detonates the mark.  When played properly this means she can restore 80 energy when double detonating her marks, and when accounting for time between the marks this costs her a total of -20-0 energy.  She actually restores more energy than required to cast if she double procs her detonation before level 5 of her Q.

Akali's energy regen mechanic costs 60-65 less energy than Zed's, provided each champion is played perfectly and other abilities aren't included.  Hers is also on a 4-6 second cooldown, whereas Zed's is at 14-18 seconds and requires the majority of his kit.

I'm fine with people ragging on Zed, but not when it's straight up misguided.

Regardless of that detonate mechanic being removed, however, the energy refund numbers still stand.  If able to autoattack your target while they have a mark, Akali's potential for energy refund is greater than Zed's and requires significantly less up-front energy investment.  

**Akali**

* 60 energy cost
* 40 energy return
* Once every 4 seconds
* One ability

Total energy refund over 28 seconds: 280

**Zed**

* 120 energy cost
* 80 energy return 
* Once every 14 seconds
* Three abilities

Total energy refund over 28 seconds: 240
BAsically Zed will do less damage in the 28 seconds.

Oh absolutely.  Zed is a true assassin, his kit revolves around dropping everything on a single target then having a relatively long period of minor utility (poke, AoE).  Akali, on the other hand, provides sustained burst.  She does less immediate damage than Zed, but over the long term she will dramatically outdamage him.
Just for fun, can you calculate Kennen and Shen's Energy like this?

Kennen and Shen are a bit more complex when considering energy regeneration mechanics, since they include autoattacks as part of this calculation.  They also fill different roles; Akali and Zed are assassins, whereas Kennen is an AoE teamfighter and Shen is a tank/bruiser.

Kennen restores a percentage of his energy consistently while using spells (correctly) due to his Mark of the Assassin functionality, and he's encouraged to space them out over a longer period of time.  

Shen has a guaranteed return of at least 30 energy every 9 seconds if he can get an autoattack in, and it goes up every time he autoattacks.  His base refund mechanic is actually the best in the game, and even Taunt's is really good if you can get maximum effectiveness out of it.  If you hit two enemies you refund 80% of the cost, and if you hit 3 it's a net gain of 20 energy.
Shen has the highest energy refund in the game, actually.

> One of the lowest CD ultimates in the game, without mana cost, and the most variety in what it can do, burning this doesn't seem like a huge deal.

Its CD might be lower than most but it's still a significant cooldown to burn. LeBlanc doesn't assassinate people without her R unless she's something like 25-0; using her ult to clear a single wave means she can't assassinate someone for up to 40 seconds and also has one of her escapes burnt (most likely both, if she uses R to waveclear she'll have used her W as well), meaning she's easy picking for the enemy mid and is effectively useless for the better part of a minute. How losing all of that for the sake of clearing a wave quicker isn't a fair trade off is beyond me.

LeBlanc has poor clear as it is and no matter how much people will have you believe she has immense waveclear, she really doesn't. She has one basic ability that can waveclear (which is also her main harass) and her ultimate for desperate situations. Someone who suggests reducing the damage her W/WR do to minions is suggesting she be completely unable to clear a wave. 

There are frustrating aspects to LeBlanc's kit that if changed, might make her feel less bad to play against. Her waveclear however is not the right thing to target. You are making a champion that is arguably not overpowered (just annoying) weaker without actually making her feel at all better to play against, which is exactly what you don't want to do. You would complain about her again the second she became strong, because you took the lazy route (this is what will happen if Akali is ever powerful again, because her nerfs were lazy as hell and did nothing to give her more counterplay).
